events.originalText: A train derailed in Eckwersheim, France, while performing trials on the high-speed rail line LGV Est.
events.subtitle: Eckwersheim derailment
events.headline: Train derails in Eckwersheim, France during high-speed rail line trials

events.originalText: Red Bull Racing's Sebastian Vettel won the Drivers' Championship after winning the final race of the season, becoming the youngest Formula One champion.
events.subtitle: Red Bull Racing
events.headline: Sebastian Vettel wins Drivers' Championship in final race of season

events.originalText: Astronomers Michael E. Brown, Chad Trujillo, and David L. Rabinowitz discovered the trans-Neptunian object Sedna (artist's impression pictured).
events.subtitle: Michael E. Brown
events.headline: Astronomers discover trans-Neptunian object Sedna

events.originalText: As a result of budget conflicts between President Bill Clinton and the United States Congress led by Newt Gingrich, the federal government was forced to shut down non-essential services.
events.subtitle: Bill Clinton
events.headline: US government shuts down non-essential services due to budget conflicts

events.originalText: In poor conditions caused by Cyclone Forrest, Vietnam Airlines Flight 474 crashed near Nha Trang, killing 30 people.
events.subtitle: Cyclone Forrest
events.headline: Vietnam Airlines Flight 474 crashes near Nha Trang, killing 30

events.originalText: Croatian War of Independence: Croatian naval commandos attacked the Yugoslav patrol boat Mukos, starting the Battle of the Dalmatian Channels.
events.subtitle: Croatian War of Independence
events.headline: Croatian naval commandos attack Yugoslav patrol boat Mukos

events.originalText: Music producer Frank Farian admitted that the German R&B duo Milli Vanilli did not sing the vocals on their album Girl You Know It's True.
events.subtitle: Frank Farian
events.headline: Milli Vanilli producer admits duo did not sing vocals on album

events.originalText: Germany and Poland signed the German–Polish Border Treaty, confirming their border at the Oder–Neisse line, which was originally defined by the Potsdam Agreement in 1945.
events.subtitle: German–Polish Border Treaty
events.headline: Germany and Poland sign German-Polish Border Treaty

events.originalText: With the signing of the Madrid Accords, Spain agreed to withdraw its presence from the territory of Spanish Sahara.
events.subtitle: Madrid Accords
events.headline: Spain agrees to withdraw from Spanish Sahara with Madrid Accords

events.originalText: Southern Airways Flight 932, chartered by the Marshall University football team, crashed into a hill near Ceredo, West Virginia, killing all 75 people on board.
events.subtitle: Southern Airways Flight 932
events.headline: Southern Airways Flight 932 crashes in West Virginia, killing 75

events.originalText: Apollo 12 launches from the Kennedy Space Center, becoming the second crewed flight to land on the moon.
events.subtitle: Apollo 12
events.headline: Apollo 12 launches, becoming second crewed flight to land on moon

events.originalText: Ruby Bridges and the McDonogh Three became the first black children to attend an all-white elementary school in Louisiana as part of the New Orleans school desegregation crisis.
events.subtitle: Ruby Bridges
events.headline: Ruby Bridges and McDonogh Three integrate Louisiana elementary school

events.originalText: Second World War: After suffering torpedo damage the previous day, the British aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal sank as she was being towed to Gibraltar for repairs.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: British aircraft carrier HMS Ark Royal sinks after torpedo damage

events.originalText: World War II: German troops, aided by local auxiliaries, murdered nine thousand residents of the Słonim Ghetto in a single day.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German troops massacre residents of Słonim Ghetto during World War II

events.originalText: Aviator Eugene Burton Ely performed the first takeoff from a ship (pictured), flying from a makeshift deck on USS Birmingham in Hampton Roads, Virginia.
events.subtitle: Eugene Burton Ely
events.headline: Aviator Eugene Burton Ely performs first ship takeoff in Virginia

events.originalText: German astronomer Gottfried Kirch discovered the Great Comet of 1680 (pictured), the first comet to be discovered by telescope.
events.subtitle: Gottfried Kirch
events.headline: Astronomer Gottfried Kirch discovers Great Comet of 1680
